title.narrative: KEIG Platform for Women's Economic Empowerment
KEIG Plattform för Kvinnors Ekonomiska Deltagande

description.narrative: KEIG plattformen är en mötesplats för olika aktörer som vill påverka policy som berör kvinnors ekonomiska deltagande. KEIG identifierar hinder och kommer med lösningar för hur policyn kan utvecklas så att kvinnor har lika tillträde till arbetsmarknaden samt anständiga arbetsförhållanden, inklusive skydd av sociala rättigheter och lika lön för lika arbete.
The aim of the project is to increase women´s employment in a decent way and eliminate the barriers that keeps women from entering the labour market.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The progress towards the intended outcome, making contribution to the increase of women´s employment in decent jobs, has overall gone according to plan. Focus has been on efforts to increase the awareness and knowledge of policy makers on women´s need for boosting decent employment within the new policy trends in the labour market.
The activities have been divided in two parts: capacity building of the member organizations and networking as well as national advocacy activities in order to make the platform´s voice heard by policy makers. KEIG has been successful in bringing women´s organisations together and offering them support to develop policies in their local arenas. The project has made it possible for KEIG to help women´s organisations become stronger when it comes to policy making capacity and they have become better at influencing local practices by strengthening their contacts with the local authorities. The number of organizations that apply to join KEIG increases every year. KEIG has closely been followed by media, academia, civil society, local administrations and public institutions since they are the only organisatioon working on issues concerning women´s labour and employment.The research and publications published by KEIG have been shown as reference at several occasions. KEIG has during the years become more active on social media which has helped them become more visible. During the project period 4 research activities have taken place with the aim to promote women´s policies within the field of women´s employment. KEIG has also conducted two preparatory activities within the scope of the ILO-Turkish Labour Agency "More and Better Jobs for Women" project also Sida funded: - improving the education of entrepreneurship for women and mapping the institutions providing early childhood care -preparation of National Action Plan for women´s employment. 15 issues of the KEIG Bulletin have been published since 2013 and this as helped the members of the platform to be informed of each other´s work and also provided a collective work experience since the Bulletin is written collectively.
The restarted conflict in Sout east of Turkey has affected KEIG´s work. For example it has been difficult to put women´s issue on the national agenda and a lot of journalists have not been able to participate in press meetings due to situation in the Southeast and the suddenly changes of agenda. KEIG has though been careful in following the developments and organized press meetings accordingly.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
